translated: The Great Compassionate Heart DhÄraá¹‡Ä« of the Bodhisattva Thousand-handed and Thousand-eyed AvalokiteÅ›vara
Translated by Amoghavajra, Tripiá¹­aka Master of the Great Tang
I bow my head to AvalokiteÅ›vara, the lord of great compassion, whose body is endowed with the marks of great vows and profound compassion
His thousand arms are adorned, universally protecting and upholding, his thousand eyes emit light, universally observing and illuminating
Within the true words, he proclaims the secret words; within the unconditioned mind, he arouses the mind of compassion
Swiftly fulfilling all aspirations, forever eliminating all evil karma
Dragons, gods, and multitudes of sages equally have compassionate protection; hundreds of thousands of samÄdhis are suddenly cultivated and practiced
The body that upholds the dhÄraá¹‡Ä« is the banner of light; the mind that upholds the dhÄraá¹‡Ä« is the treasury of spiritual powers
Washing away afflictions and vows to save the ocean of beings; transcending and realizing the gate of skillful means of bodhi
I now chant and vow to take refuge; all my wishes will be fulfilled as I wishğŸ”½Homage to the greatly compassionate AvalokiteÅ›vara; may I quickly understand all dharmas
Homage to the greatly compassionate AvalokiteÅ›vara; may I early attain the eye of wisdom

Homage to the Greatly Compassionate Avalokitesvara Bodhisattva, may I quickly liberate all beings.ğŸ”½Homage to the Greatly Compassionate Avalokitesvara Bodhisattva, may I quickly attain skillful means.
Homage to the Greatly Compassionate Avalokitesvara Bodhisattva, may I quickly board the ship of prajna.
Homage to the Greatly Compassionate Avalokitesvara Bodhisattva, may I quickly cross the sea of suffering.

Homage to the Greatly Compassionate Avalokitesvara Bodhisattva, may I quickly attain the path of precepts and samadhi.ğŸ”½Homage to the Greatly Compassionate Avalokitesvara Bodhisattva, may I quickly ascend the mountain of nirvana.
Homage to the Greatly Compassionate Avalokitesvara Bodhisattva, may I quickly enter the abode of non-action.
Homage to the Greatly Compassionate Avalokitesvara Bodhisattva, may I quickly attain the body of the nature of dharmas.
If I go to the mountain of swords, the mountain of swords will break by itself.
If I go to the boiling water, the boiling water will evaporate by itself.
If I go to the hells, the hells will dry up by themselves.
If I go to the hungry ghosts, the hungry ghosts will be satisfied by themselves.
If I face the asuras, the evil mind will subdue itself.
If I face the animals, I will naturally attain great wisdom.
After making this vow,
with utmost sincerity, chant my name.
You should also single-mindedly contemplate my original teacher, AmitÃ¢bha TathÃ¢gata.
Then, you should recite this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« mantra.
Recite it five times in one night.
It will eliminate the heavy karmic offenses of birth and death accumulated over a hundred thousand koá¹­Ä«s of kalpas in one's body.
Homage to AmitÃ¢bha TathÃ¢gata, Homage to AvalokitÃªÅ›vara Bodhisattva MahÄsattva. AvalokitÃªÅ›vara Bodhisattva again addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One, if there are humans and gods
who recite and uphold the chapter of the great compassion,
when their life is about to end,
the Buddhas of the ten directions will all come and offer their hands.
If they wish to be born in any Buddha land,
they will all attain rebirth according to their wishes.
He further addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One, if there are sentient beings
who recite and uphold this great compassionate divine mantra but fall into the three evil destinies,
I vow that I will not attain perfect enlightenment.
For those who recite and uphold the great compassionate divine mantra,
If they do not attain rebirth in the buddha lands,
I vow that I will not attain perfect enlightenment.
For those who recite and uphold the great compassionate divine mantra,
If their minds do not attain immeasurable samÄdhi and eloquence,
I vow that I will not attain perfect enlightenment.
For those who recite and uphold the great compassionate mind divine mantra,
In their present lives,
If all their wishes are not fulfilled,
It cannot be called the great compassionate mind dhÄraá¹‡Ä«.
Except for those who are unwholesome and insincere,
If there are women who despise their female bodies
And wish to become men,
They should recite and uphold the chapter on the great compassionate dhÄraá¹‡Ä«.
If they do not transform their female bodies into male bodies,
I vow that I will not attain perfect enlightenment.
Those who give rise to doubts will certainly not attain their wishes.
If there are sentient beings who encroach upon and damage the food and wealth of the eternal abode,
Even if a thousand Buddhas appeared in the world, they would not allow repentance.
Even if one is able to repent, it would not be eliminated.
Now, by reciting the great compassionate divine mantra, it can be eliminated.
If one has used the food, drink, and property of the Sangha,
One must repent to the teachers of the ten directions.
Only then can it be eliminated.
Now, when reciting the great compassionate dhÄraá¹‡Ä«,
The Buddhas of the ten directions will come and serve as witnesses.
All karmic hindrances will be completely eliminated.
All ten evil deeds, five heinous crimes, slandering of people, and slandering of the Dharma,
Violating precepts, breaking precepts, destroying stupas and temples,
Stealing from the Sangha's property, defiling pure conduct,
All such evil karmic heavy offenses will be completely eradicated.
There is only one exception.
Those who have doubts about the mantra,
Even minor offenses and light karma cannot be eliminated,
Let alone heavy offenses.
Although heavy offenses cannot be immediately eliminated,
It can still serve as a distant cause for enlightenment.
He further said to the Buddha,
World-Honored One, if people and gods recite and uphold the great compassionate heart mantra,
They will attain fifteen kinds of good rebirth,
And not experience fifteen kinds of evil death.
As for the evil deaths,
First, they will not cause people to die of hunger and suffering.
Second, they will not die from imprisonment, beatings, or punishments.
Third, they will not die from enemies or grudges.
Fourth, they will not die in battlefields or from mutual killing.
Fifth, they will not die from being harmed by tigers, wolves, or vicious beasts.
Sixth, they will not die from being bitten by poisonous snakes or scorpions.
Seventh, they will not die from drowning or being burned by water or fire.
Eighth, they will not die from being poisoned.
Ninth, they will not die from being harmed by insect poisons.
Tenth, they will not die from insanity or losing their memory.
Eleventh, they will not die from falling off cliffs or from trees.ğŸ”½Twelfth, they will not die from being bewitched by evil people.
Thirteenth, they will not die from being taken advantage of by evil spirits or ghosts.
Fourteenth, they will not die with evil illnesses afflicting their bodies.
Fifteenth, they will not die by self-harm that is not appropriate.
Those who recite and uphold the great compassionate divine mantra
will not suffer these fifteen kinds of evil deaths.
Obtaining fifteen kinds of good births means:
First, wherever they are born, they will always encounter a virtuous king.
Second, they will always be born in a good country.
Third, they will always encounter a good time.
Fourth, they will always meet good friends.
Fifth, their faculties will always be complete.
Sixth, their resolve for the Way will be fully mature.
Seventh, they will not violate the precepts.
Eighth, their relatives will be harmonious and respectful.
Ninth, they will always have abundant resources and food.
Tenth, they will always be respected and served by others.
Eleventh, their wealth and treasures will not be stolen by others.
Twelfth, whatever they wish for will be accomplished.
Thirteenth, dragons, gods, and virtuous spirits will always guard them.
Fourteenth, in the places where they are born, they see the Buddha and hear the Dharma.
Fifteenth, they understand the profound meaning of the true Dharma they hear.
If there are those who recite and uphold the MahÄmÄyÅ«rÄ«vidyÄrÄjÃ±Ä« DhÄraá¹‡Ä«,
They will attain these fifteen kinds of good rebirths.
All devas and humans should always recite and uphold it without being lazy.

In the presence of the assembly, joined his palms and stood upright.
He gave rise to a mind of great compassion for all beings,
Opened his face and smiled.
He then spoke this vast, perfect, unobstructed MahÄmÄyÅ«rÄ«vidyÄrÄjÃ±Ä« DhÄraá¹‡Ä«, a wondrous chapter.
